Jio Coin launched? User claims Mukesh Ambani's new cryptocurrency is live and 'you can accumulate coins on - The Economic Times
summary:
Jio Coin launched? User claims Mukesh Ambani's new cryptocurrency is live and you can accumulate coins.

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Jio Platforms, led by Mukesh Ambani, has reportedly launched a new reward token called JioCoin on the Polygon blockchain network. The launch has sparked discussions on its potential uses, though the company has not yet disclosed official details about the token’s functionality.

  • JioCoin is integrated into JioSphere and rewards users for browsing online.
  • Currently, the token is not transferable or redeemable.
  • It may be used for services such as mobile recharges or purchases at Reliance gas stations in the future.
  • The launch comes amid strict regulations on cryptocurrencies in India.
  • Jio Platforms serves over 450 million users, playing a significant role in India's digital economy.
— simplykashif (@simplykashif)

The future of JioCoin remains uncertain but could have significant implications as it becomes integrated into Jio's ecosystem.

Did Trump just drop $TRUMP meme coin on Solana? Token explodes to $8 billion market cap in less than three hours - Crypto Briefing
summary:
Did Trump just drop $TRUMP meme coin on Solana? Token explodes to $8 billion market cap in less than three hours

Publication Date: January 18, 2025

Source: Crypto Briefing

President-elect Donald Trump launched the Official Trump ($TRUMP) meme coin on Solana, which saw its market cap reach $8 billion in under three hours, raising concerns about the authenticity of the announcements.

Key Takeaways

  • $TRUMP meme coin reached a market cap of $8 billion within two hours of launch.
  • Authenticity concerns arose due to the official announcement being shared on social media.

“Same Cloudflare setup, same deployment with Heroku, same SSL certificate issuer. Very similar HTML structure as before,” says Cygaar, a blockchain engineer.

Slorg, a member of Jupiter’s Core Working Group, confirmed that $TRUMP has been verified and listed on Jupiter Exchange.

“But to keep people safe, this is the real Trump coin. We have approved it to the Jupiter strictlist,” said Slorg.

What we know so far?

The $TRUMP token has a total supply of 1 billion units, with 200 million available at launch. The rest will be released gradually over three years.
newTitle: Trump's $TRUMP Meme Coin Soars to $8 Billion Market Cap in Hours

title: What does Donald Trump’s second term mean for Indian stock market? EXPLAINED with five crucial points - Mint
summary:
What does Donald Trump’s second term mean for Indian stock market? EXPLAINED with five crucial points

Publication Date: January 18, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Introduction: As Donald Trump prepares for his second term, the Indian stock market is poised for potential shifts influenced by his administration's economic policies. Investors are particularly concerned about tariffs, trade agreements, and geopolitical tensions affecting the market landscape.

Trump 2.0: Top 5 Points

  • Dent to green stocks: Asia's energy transition may be hindered, putting pressure on India's solar and green energy stocks.
  • Advantage for defence stocks: Increased focus on tech-enabled defence sectors is expected to benefit Indian defence companies.
  • Pressure for export-oriented companies: Protectionist policies might challenge sectors like textiles and IT, advising caution in large-cap investments.
  • Advantage for fintech stocks: Stricter immigration policies may enhance tech talent retention in Asia, benefiting fintech innovation.
  • Advantages for infra rail stocks: Potential shifts in manufacturing from China to India could drive demand for infrastructure and rail logistics.

Notable Quote: "Donald Trump's protectionist tariff policy is expected to pose a challenge for export-oriented segments" - Anshul Jain, Head of Research at Lakshmishree Investment and Securities.

Conclusion: Investors should stay alert as Trump's second term could significantly influence various sectors in the Indian stock market, requiring careful analysis and strategy.
newTitle: What Trump's Second Term Means for Indian Stock Market: Key Insights

title: Musk hosts Indian bizmen, says 'open to lowering India-US trade barriers' - Business Standard
summary:
Musk Hosts Indian Bizmen, Says 'Open to Lowering India-US Trade Barriers'

Publication Date: January 17, 2025   Source: PTI

During a meeting at SpaceX’s Starbase in Texas, Elon Musk engaged with top Indian business figures, expressing a willingness to reduce trade barriers between the US and India to foster economic growth.

Key Points

  • Elon Musk hosted a delegation of Indian entrepreneurs including Ritesh Agarwal (OYO) and Kalyan Raman (Flipkart).
  • The meeting aims to enhance trade relations between India and the US.
  • Musk expressed optimism about the future trajectory of bilateral ties.
  • Discussions included potential roles for Musk in the new US administration.

Notable Quotes

“Things are trending positive. I’m certainly in favour of lowering trade barriers to increase commerce between the US and India.” - Elon Musk

Conclusion

The meeting signifies a growing collaboration between India and the US in technology and trade, highlighted by Musk's commitment to fostering a more interconnected business environment.
newTitle: Musk Meets Indian Business Leaders to Strengthen India-US Trade Relations

summary:
Jio Coin: Mukesh Ambani-led telco's crypto entry? All about Jio Platforms’ partnership with Polygon Labs

Publication Date: Jan 18, 2025 Source: etnownews.com

India’s richest person Mukesh Ambani-led Jio Platforms recently announced its partnership with internet technology company Polygon Labs. The announcement has sparked widespread interest in 'JioCoin', with users speculating its potential uses.

  • Jio Coin is a potential digital currency tied to Jio's services.
  • Rumors suggest it could be used for mobile recharges and purchases at Reliance gas stations.
  • The partnership with Polygon Labs aims to enhance Jio's offerings through blockchain and Web3 capabilities.
  • This collaboration could allow Jio users to enjoy enhanced privacy and control over personal data.
  • Jio caters to over 450 million customers, potentially expanding their services through this digital currency.
“Joining forces with Polygon Labs marks a significant milestone in Jio's journey towards digital excellence. We are excited to explore the boundless possibilities of Web3 and bring unparalleled digital experiences to our users.” - Kiran Thomas, CEO, JPL

This partnership signifies Jio's entry into the crypto industry, as Polygon Labs is a leading player in blockchain technology.

title: Paul Graham backs Mark Zuckerberg’s charges against ex-Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg: ‘Common for young, inexperienced…’ - Mint
summary:
Paul Graham Supports Zuckerberg's Comments on Sheryl Sandberg

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

Paul Graham, a noted computer scientist and writer, has expressed support for Meta's CEO Mark Zuckerberg after accusations against former COO Sheryl Sandberg regarding Facebook's culture and inclusivity policies.

  • Graham responded to criticism of Zuckerberg on social media, emphasizing that young founders often rely on experienced executives for guidance.
  • He noted that it is common for inexperienced leaders to follow the advice of convincing C-level executives.
  • Zuckerberg referred to Sandberg's initiatives as contributing to organizational issues during a meeting with President Trump.
  • Meta has recently shifted its approach to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) efforts, affecting its internal policies.
“Come on bruh.... You were the CEO with super voting shares --- own your decisions.” — @jason

Sheryl Sandberg left Facebook in 2022 but was still on Meta's board until the previous year.
newTitle: Paul Graham Supports Zuckerberg's Comments on Sheryl Sandberg

title: Jio Financial Services Q3 Results Highlights: Net profit up 0.3% to ₹295 crore, AUM surges to ₹4,199 crore | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Jio Financial Services Q3 Results Highlights: Net profit up 0.3% to ₹295 crore, AUM surges to ₹4,199 crore

Date: 17 Jan 2025 Source: HT Digital Streams Limited

Jio Financial Services reported a 0.3 per cent increase in net profit at ₹295 crore for the third quarter of fiscal 2024-25.

  • Net profit for Q3FY25 is ₹295 crore, a marginal increase from ₹294 crore in Q3FY24.
  • Assets under management (AUM) surged to ₹4,199 crore, significantly up from ₹1,206 crore.
  • Revenue from operations increased by 6% year-on-year to ₹438.4 crore.
  • Market capitalization exceeds ₹1.76 lakh crore.
  • The company is expanding its portfolio including loans and digital finance services.
“We are expanding our portfolio of services, elevating user experience, and harnessing the power of cutting-edge technology” - Mukesh Ambani

This quarter's performance reflects Jio Financial Services' ongoing growth and strategic developments in the non-banking finance sector.
newTitle: Jio Financial Services Q3 Results Highlights: Net Profit Up Marginally

Tata Sons Faces Potential Mandatory IPO Amid NBFC-UL Classification by RBI; All You Need To Know - News18
summary:
Tata Sons Faces Potential Mandatory IPO Amid NBFC-UL Classification by RBI

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: News18

Tata Sons, the holding company of Tata Group, could be required to list on stock exchanges by September 2025 following its identification as an NBFC-UL by the RBI. The company’s application for de-registration, which would exempt it from this requirement, is still under review.

Key Points:

  • Tata Sons identified as an Upper Layer Non-Banking Financial Company (NBFC-UL) by RBI.
  • Must list on stock exchanges by September 2025 unless de-registered.
  • The RBI’s list includes Tata Capital and other financial companies.
  • The classification leads to enhanced regulatory oversight for large NBFCs.
“Inclusion of Tata Sons Private Limited in the list of NBFC-UL is without prejudice to the outcome of its application for de-registration, which is under examination.” – RBI

This development highlights the ongoing regulatory challenges faced by prominent financial entities in India and could significantly impact Tata Group's operations.
newTitle: Tata Sons Faces Potential Mandatory IPO Amid NBFC-UL Classification by RBI

title: Maha Kumbh: Companies rope in influencers to amplify their brands - The Economic Times
summary:
Maha Kumbh: Companies Engage Influencers for Brand Promotion

Publication Date: Current; Source: Economic Times

The ongoing Maha Kumbh is witnessing major brands partnering with influencers to enhance their outreach and engagement with devotees. This approach marks a significant fusion of traditional religious events with modern marketing strategies.

  • Amazon is utilizing influencers to promote their box beds for devotees in Prayagraj.
  • ITC is collaborating with regional influencers to market Bingo snacks.
  • Coca-Cola is launching special edition packs and setting up hydration carts at the event, while also engaging influencers.
  • Industry experts believe influencer collaborations can generate awareness, even if immediate sales impacts are not notable.
  • Local authorities have implemented guidelines regulating influencer activities at the Kumbh, ensuring security and adherence to community standards.
"Influencers form an integral part of the way we tell our stories. As they share their experiences, they provide a lens for their fans to be part of this experience." - Greishma Singh, President of Marketing at Coca-Cola India

The blending of influencer marketing with traditional events like the Maha Kumbh reflects a changing landscape in consumer engagement, emphasizing the role of social media in modern branding.
newTitle: Maha Kumbh: Companies Engage Influencers for Brand Promotion

title: Havells India Surges 4% As Q3 Revenue Rises 11%, Dividend Declared; Should You Invest? - News18
summary:
Havells India Surges 4% As Q3 Revenue Rises 11%, Dividend Declared; Should You Invest?

Last Updated: January 17, 2025, 16:46 IST

Shares of Havells India surged by 3.9%, reaching an intraday high of Rs 1,617.95 on the BSE, following the company’s Q3 FY25 results announced on Thursday. Although the company posted a slight 1.7% year-on-year (YoY) decline in net profit at Rs 283 crore, its net revenue grew by 11% YoY, reaching Rs 4,883 crore.

  • Switchgears division: 10.8% YoY growth, Rs 577 crore revenue.
  • Cable segment: 7.3% YoY increase.
  • Lighting & Fixtures segment: 2.5% growth.
  • Electrical Consumer Durables: 15% YoY growth.
  • Other segments: 22.8% YoY rise.

Additionally, the company declared an interim dividend of Rs 4 per share, with the record date set for January 22.

Brokerage Views on Havells’ Q3 Results:

UBS: Buy | Target Price: Rs 2,145 | Upside Potential: 37.7%

JP Morgan: Neutral | Target Price: Rs 1,750 | Upside Potential: 12.4%

Disclaimer: The views and investment tips by experts in this report are their own and not those of the website or its management.
newTitle: Havells India Surges 4% As Q3 Revenue Rises 11%, Dividend Declared; Should You Invest?
